plugin.name: ANOVA
plugin.description: The geWorkbench ANOVA component implements a one-way analysis of variance calculation derived from TIGR's MeV (MultiExperiment Viewer) (Saeed, 2003). At least three groups of arrays must be specified by defining and activating them in the Arrays/Phenotypes component.

plugin.name: ARACNe
plugin.description: ARACNe (Algorithm for the Reconstruction of Accurate Cellular Networks) (Basso 2005, Margolin 2006a, 2006b) is an information-theoretic algorithm used to identify transcriptional interactions between gene products using microarray gene expression profile data.

plugin.name: Cellular Network Knowledge Base
plugin.description: The Cellular Network Knowledge Base (CNKB) is a repository of molecular interactions, including ones both computationally and experimentally derived. Sources for interactions include both publicly available databases such as BioGRID and HPRD, as well as reverse-engineered cellular regulatory interactomes developed in the lab of Dr. Andrea Califano at Columbia University.

plugin.name: Hierarchical Clustering
plugin.description: Hierarchical clustering is a method to group arrays and/or markers together based on similarity on their expression profiles. geWorkbench implements its own code for agglomerative hierarchical clustering. Starting from individual points (the leaves of the tree), nearest neighbors are found for individual points, and then for groups of points, at each step building up a branched structure that converges toward a root that contains all points. The resulting graph tends to group similar items together.

plugin.name: Differential Expression (T-Test)
plugin.description: A t-Test analysis can be used to identify markers with statistically significant differential expression between two sets of microarrays.

plugin.name: MarkUs
plugin.description: MarkUs is a web server to assist the assessment of the biochemical function for a given protein structure. MarkUs identifies related protein structures and sequences, detects protein cavities, and calculates the surface electrostatic potentials and amino acid conservation profile.

plugin.name: PDB File Viewer
plugin.description: A simple text viewer for PDB file.

plugin.name: ANOVA Result Viewer
plugin.description: Show ANOVA result as a table.

plugin.name: Cytoscape
plugin.description: Show network in cytoscape web, or in text view.

plugin.name: CNKB Result View
plugin.description: Show CNKB Result including throttle plot.

plugin.name: MARKUS result viewer
plugin.description: Show result MARKUS result in embedded browser

plugin.name: Tabular Microarray Viewer
plugin.description: Presents the numerical values of the expression measurements in a table format. One row is created per individual marker/probe and one column per microarray.

plugin.name: T-test result viewer
plugin.description: Viewing t-test result as a Volcano plot.
